intro: Cyrtopera longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepal cyrtopera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Cyrtopera longisepala thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
